goal: Add JWT-based authentication endpoint to API
acceptance_criteria: POST /api/auth/login returns JWT access and refresh tokens
POST /api/auth/refresh accepts refresh token and returns new access token
JWT tokens expire after 15 minutes (access) and 7 days (refresh)
All endpoints require authentication via JWT in Authorization header
OpenAPI schema updated with new endpoints
approach: Use djangorestframework-simplejwt library. Create auth views, serializers, and URL routing. Add JWT authentication class to DRF settings. Write comprehensive tests.
verification_plan: Verify OpenAPI schema: make -C backend openapi
Manual test: Use Postman/curl to test login and token refresh endpoints
risks: Security: JWT implementation must follow best practices (HITL required)
Breaking change: Existing API clients may need updates
Token storage: Refresh tokens must be stored securely
rollback_plan: Revert commits. Remove JWT settings from config. Restore previous authentication method. Update OpenAPI schema.
hitl_requirements: HITL-0001: Security review for JWT implementation (Category: Risk)
notes: This task implements authentication as part of TASK-045. Related to security baseline triggers 1 (auth/login) and 9 (cryptography).
